joint_involvement.justification: Multiple mentions of polyarthrite rhumatoïde (confirmed) and multiple joint involvements, including large joints and small joints.

serology.justification: High-positive RF (100 UI/mL) and positive anti-CCP (>30 U/mL).

acute_phase.justification: CRP is unknown, but CRP values are mentioned in the lab results.

duration.justification: Patient on methotrexate (a DMARD), suggesting chronic disease and long-standing condition.

treatment_context.justification: The patient is on methotrexate, a first-line DMARD. This provides strong evidence of established rheumatoid arthritis.

classification_rationale: The patient has high-positive RF and positive anti-CCP, multiple joint involvements (large and small joints), and is on methotrexate for treatment of chronic disease. This meets the criteria for a strong evidence classification.

retrieved_guidelines.title: Clinical Context
retrieved_guidelines.content:
Treatment patterns provide additional evidence:
- Methotrexate (MTX) = first-line csDMARD
- Biologic DMARDs (anti-TNF, anti-IL6, etc.) = established RA
- JAK inhibitors = treatment-refractory RA

In clinical practice:
- Score ≥6/10 = definite RA
- Score 4-5/10 + DMARD treatment = probable established RA
- Score ≥5/10 without treatment = borderline, likely RA
retrieved_guidelines.text:
Clinical Context Treatment patterns provide additional evidence:
- Methotrexate (MTX) = first-line csDMARD
- Biologic DMARDs (anti-TNF, anti-IL6, etc.) = established RA
- JAK inhibitors = treatment-refractory RA

In clinical practice:
- Score ≥6/10 = definite RA
- Score 4-5/10 + DMARD treatment = probable established RA
- Score ≥5/10 without treatment = borderline, likely RA

retrieved_guidelines.title: Category B: Serology (0-3 points)
retrieved_guidelines.content:
- Negative RF AND negative ACPA: 0 points
- Low-positive RF OR low-positive ACPA (≤3× ULN): 2 points
- High-positive RF OR high-positive ACPA (>3× ULN): 3 points

RF = Rheumatoid Factor
ACPA = Anti-citrullinated protein antibody (anti-CCP)
ULN = Upper limit of normal (typically RF: 20 IU/mL, anti-CCP: 10 U/mL)
retrieved_guidelines.text:
Category B: Serology (0-3 points) - Negative RF AND negative ACPA: 0 points
- Low-positive RF OR low-positive ACPA (≤3× ULN): 2 points
- High-positive RF OR high-positive ACPA (>3× ULN): 3 points

RF = Rheumatoid Factor
ACPA = Anti-citrullinated protein antibody (anti-CCP)
ULN = Upper limit of normal (typically RF: 20 IU/mL, anti-CCP: 10 U/mL)

retrieved_guidelines.title: Category A: Joint Involvement (0-5 points)
retrieved_guidelines.content:
- 1 large joint: 0 points
- 2-10 large joints: 1 point
- 1-3 small joints (with or without large joints): 2 points
- 4-10 small joints (with or without large joints): 3 points
- >10 joints (at least 1 small joint): 5 points

Large joints: shoulders, elbows, hips, knees, ankles
Small joints: MCPs, PIPs, MTPs (2nd-5th), thumb IPs, wrists

Large joints: shoulders, elbows, hips, knees, ankles
Small joints: MCPs, PIPs, MTPs (2nd-5th), thumb IPs, wrists
